definitions.text: a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon
examples: the magnetic effect was greater when the rod was lengthwise
his decision had depressing consequences for business
he acted very wise after the event
I wanted to create an impression of success
she retained that bold effect in her reproductions of the original painting

definitions.text: an impression (especially one that is artificial or contrived)
examples: he just did it for effect

definitions.text: the central meaning or theme of a speech or literary work

examples: the law is still in effect

definitions.text: a symptom caused by an illness or a drug

examples: The scientists set up a shock wave

definitions.text: act so as to bring into existence
